intro: Eritrichium basifixum, commonly known as the rock erythronium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are basal, palmately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. Eritrichium basifixum is known for its early spring blooming habit, making it a notable wildflower in its native range.
